the Pontifical Commission for Latin America.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="3"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> His close working relationship with Pope Francis was further underscored by his elevation to the rank of Cardinal on September 30, 2023 <span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span>, and his subsequent appointment as Cardinal-Bishop of Albano in February 2025.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="32"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> This consistent elevation within the Vatican hierarchy under Pope Francis strongly suggests a deep level of trust and a shared vision for the direction of the Church.<sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c420645924=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" class="button-container hide-from-message-actions ng-star-inserted"> &nbsp; <button ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="17:1-17:957">The election of the Pope takes place within the Papal Conclave, a tradition steeped in centuries of history.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> This assembly gathers the College of Cardinals, specifically those under the age of 80, in the Sistine Chapel, where they are secluded until a new Pope is elected.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="8"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Following the passing of Pope Francis, the conclave to elect his successor commenced on May 7th, 2025.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="6"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> The process involves repeated rounds of secret balloting, with a successful election requiring a two-thirds majority of the votes cast.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> A visual signal is provided to the outside world after each voting session: black smoke emanating from a chimney above the Sistine Chapel indicates that no Pope has been elected, while white smoke signifies a successful election.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="19:1-19:1080">The conclave of 2025 reached its conclusion relatively swiftly. On the second day, May 8th, 2025, white smoke billowed from the Sistine Chapel chimney, announcing to the world that a new Pope had been chosen.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> This visual signal was accompanied by the joyous ringing of the great bells of St. Peter's Basilica.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Following tradition, the announcement "Habemus Papam" ("We have a Pope") was made from the central balcony (loggia) of St. Peter's Basilica by Cardinal Dominique Mamberti, the Cardinal Protodeacon.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Subsequently, Cardinal Prevost appeared on the balcony, revealing his chosen papal name: Leo XIV.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> The relatively rapid conclusion of the conclave, likely after the fourth ballot <span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="5"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span>, suggests a notable degree of consensus among the cardinal electors regarding Cardinal Prevost. The detailed and secretive nature of the conclave process underscores the profound spiritual and historical weight associated with the election of the leader of the Catholic Church.<sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c420645924=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" class="button-container data-sourcepos="21:1-21:569">The tradition of a newly elected Pope adopting a new name is a practice rich in symbolism.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> This act often signifies a fresh beginning for the pontificate and can also indicate a Pope's intention to align his leadership with the legacies of previous Popes or venerated saints. The name "Leo" has been chosen by thirteen previous Popes, with five of them being recognized as saints.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Among these predecessors, two stand out for their significant impact on the Church's history: Leo I (the Great) and Leo XIII.<sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c420645924=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-46 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-46 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-46 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="23:1-23:458">Pope Leo I, who reigned from 440 to 461 AD, is celebrated for his courageous confrontation with Attila the Hun, his pivotal role in solidifying the orthodox understanding of Christ's nature at the Council of Chalcedon, and his strong assertion of papal authority.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="66"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> His papacy is remembered for its defense of the faith against various heresies and its strengthening of the primacy of the Church of Rome.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote data-sourcepos="25:1-25:510">Pope Leo XIII, who led the Church from 1878 to 1903, is renowned for his intellectual contributions, most notably his encyclical <em>Rerum Novarum</em>, which addressed the pressing issues of workers' rights and social justice during the Industrial Revolution.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> He is credited with softening the Church's stance towards modernity, particularly in the realms of science and politics, and for laying the groundwork for modern Catholic social thought.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-48 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-48 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-48 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-48 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-48 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="27:1-27:652">The choice of the name Leo XIV by Robert Francis Prevost potentially signals an intention to draw inspiration from the legacies of these influential figures. It could suggest a desire for a papacy characterized by both strength and authority in upholding Church doctrine, reminiscent of Leo I, and a commitment to engaging with the complexities of the modern world while championing social justice, echoing the priorities of Leo XIII.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Furthermore, the name "Leo" itself, derived from the Latin word for "lion," carries symbolic connotations of courage, strength, and royal dignity, qualities often associated with the papacy.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="71"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span><sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c420645924=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" class="button-container hide-from-message-actions ng-star-inserted"> &nbsp; <button _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" aria-label="Learn More" aria-controls="sources" class="mat-mdc-tooltip-trigger button image-fade-on hide-from-message-actions" aria-expanded="false" jslog="220646;track:generic_click,impression" aria-describedby="cdk-describedby-message-ng-1-32" cdk-describedby-host="ng-1"><mat-icon _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" role="img" class="mat-icon notranslate symbol google-symbols mat-ligature-font mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font" data-mat-icon-name="expand_more" fonticon="expand_more"></mat-icon></button><!----></span><!----><sources-carousel _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" id="sources" _nghost-ng-c133458523="" class="ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide-from-message-actions ng-star-inserted" style="display: flex; visibility: hidden;"><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" class="container ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide" jslog="220997;BardVeMetadataKey:[null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,[7,null,1]]"><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" class="carousel-container ng-tns-c133458523-49"><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" class="carousel-content ng-tns-c133458523-49"><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-49 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="29:1-29:735">Pope Leo XIV's career prior to his election was marked by extensive service in various capacities within the Catholic Church. His more than two decades spent in Peru as a missionary and later as a bishop provided him with invaluable insights into the realities of the Church in Latin America and the broader Global South.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> His fluency in both Spanish and Italian <span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="9"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> further facilitated his ministry in this diverse region. Described as "cosmopolitan and shy" yet "appreciated by conservatives and progressives" <span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="3"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span>, his work in Peru, including efforts to support Venezuelan immigrants, garnered praise.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="9"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span><sources-carousel-inline ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER" _nghost-ng-c420645924=""><!----><span _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" class="button-container hide-from-message-actions ng-star-inserted"> &nbsp; <button _ngcontent-ng-c420645924="" hide-from-message-actions="" aria-label="Learn More" aria-controls="sources" class="mat-mdc-tooltip-trigger button image-fade-on hide-from-message-actions" ng-tns-c133458523-52 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline><p data-sourcepos="43:1-43:714">Pope Leo XIV's initial pronouncements and his established record offer insights into his perspectives on key issues facing the Church. In his first address as Pope, he emphasized a message of peace, dialogue, and missionary evangelization, echoing the greeting of the Risen Christ: "Peace be with you".<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> He called for people to move forward "without fear," stating that "God loves everyone; evil will not prevail".<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="5"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> His initial words and actions, such as donning the traditional red cape of the papacy, a garment eschewed by his predecessor, Pope Francis, during his election, suggest a potential leaning towards tradition while still embodying the Church's increasingly global identity.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote data-turn-source-index="1"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span><sources-carousel-inline seen by many as signaling a degree of continuity with the priorities of Pope Francis, particularly concerning outreach to the Global South and reform within the Church hierarchy.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="2"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Experts have noted his similar value for championing the poor.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="5"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> However, there are indications of potential divergence from Pope Francis' more progressive stances on certain social issues. Notably, during his time as bishop of Chiclayo, he expressed objections to the promotion of gender ideology in schools, stating it seeks to create genders that do not exist.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="41"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Furthermore, in 2012, he reportedly lamented the influence of Western media and popular culture in fostering "sympathy for beliefs and practices that are at odds with the gospel," specifically mentioning the "homosexual lifestyle" and "alternative families comprised of same-sex partners and their adopted children".<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="9"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> While he showed mild support for the Vatican's 2023 document <em>Fiducia Supplicans</em>, which permits non-liturgical blessings for couples in irregular situations, including same-sex couples, he emphasized the need for national bishops' conferences to have doctrinal authority in interpreting and applying such directives.<span><response-element class="" nuances, Pope Leo XIV's initial address emphasized the need for a "missionary church" that "builds bridges and dialogue" and is "always open to receive everyone".<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote Francis, acknowledging his blessing to Rome and the world.<span><response-element class="" service, stating that a bishop "is not supposed to be a little prince sitting in his kingdom" but is called to be humble and close to the people he serves.<span><response-element class="" to the papacy has not been without its challenges and controversies. Concerns have been raised regarding his past handling of allegations of clerical sexual abuse, both during his time as provincial of the Augustinian Province in Chicago and later as bishop of Chiclayo in Peru.<span><response-element class="" provincial in Chicago in 2000, he approved the residence of Father James Ray, a priest with a history of sexual abuse of minors, at an Augustinian priory located near a Catholic elementary school.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="32"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> This decision has drawn criticism, particularly as it occurred before the implementation of stricter guidelines by the U.S. Conference of Catholic Bishops in 2002 for handling such cases.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote assigned a monitor during his stay <span><response-element class="" the safety of children.<span><response-element class="" ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="53:1-53:1227">More recently, while serving as bishop of Chiclayo, allegations surfaced regarding the diocese's handling of abuse claims made by three sisters against two priests, dating back to 2007.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="33"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> The sisters claimed that in 2022, when they reported the abuse, Bishop Prevost failed to open a proper investigation.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="90"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> The Diocese of Chiclayo has maintained that the accusations were handled according to canonical norms, stating that Cardinal Prevost met with the women, encouraged them to take their case to civil authorities, and initiated an initial canonical investigation that was later forwarded to the Vatican.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="20"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> However, the alleged victims dispute the existence of a formal investigation during Cardinal Prevost's tenure.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="90"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> The Vatican reportedly found insufficient evidence to proceed with the case, as did the local prosecutor's office.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="3"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> Supporters of Cardinal Prevost emphasize that he followed the required procedures under Church law and that the allegations have been unfairly reported.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote _nghost-ng-c2857890285="" class="ng-star-inserted"><sup _ngcontent-ng-c2857890285="" class="superscript" data-turn-source-index="33"><!----></sup></source-footnote><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></response-element></span> These controversies have prompted concerns from abuse survivor advocates who emphasize the need for the next Pope to act with integrity and without bias in handling abuse cases.<span><response-element class="" ng-version="0.0.0-PLACEHOLDER"><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><source-footnote jslog="220997;BardVeMetadataKey:[null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,null,[15,null,1]]"><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" class="carousel-container _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c133458523="" data-test-id="sources-carousel-source" class="sources-carousel-source ng-tns-c133458523-58 hide ng-star-inserted"><!----></div><!----><!----></div></div><!----></div><!----></sources-carousel><!----><!----><!----></sources-carousel-inline></p><p data-sourcepos="55:1-55:1126">In conclusion, the election of Robert Francis Prevost as Pope Leo XIV marks a significant moment for the Catholic Church, ushering in the first American Pontiff. His extensive background in missionary work in Peru, coupled with his leadership within the Augustinian order and his recent influential role in the Vatican as Prefect of the Dicastery for Bishops, suggests a leader with a broad understanding of the Church's global landscape and administrative experience. His choice of the name Leo evokes the legacies of past influential Popes, hinting at a potential blend of upholding tradition and engaging with contemporary challenges. While his initial statements indicate a continuity with Pope Francis' emphasis on outreach and reform, his past stances on certain social issues suggest possible nuances in his approach. The controversies surrounding his handling of abuse allegations present a significant challenge as he begins his pontificate. Ultimately, the papacy of Pope Leo XIV will be defined by his actions in addressing the diverse needs and challenges facing the global Catholic community in the years to come.</p></div></message-content><!----><!----><deep-research-source-lists _ngcontent-ng-c835721682="" _nghost-ng-c956758671="" class="ng-tns-c956758671-35 ng-tns-c835721682-26 ng-star-inserted" class="thinking-panel ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-trigger ng-trigger-thinkingPanelAnimation"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted"><mat-icon data-mat-icon-type="font" data-mat-icon-name="spark"></mat-icon></div><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 is-first mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Verifying the Announcement</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I'm starting my research by trying to confirm the announcement that Robert Francis Prevost has been named Pope Leo XIV today, May 8th, 2025. This is the first and most crucial piece of information to verify.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Initial Research Focus</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">Assuming the announcement is accurate, my next steps will involve gathering comprehensive biographical details about Robert Francis Prevost. This includes his birth information, educational background, and his journey within the Church leading up to this significant event.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Understanding His Background</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I also plan to investigate his previous roles and responsibilities within the Vatican or any religious orders he was a part of. Understanding his past experiences will be key to building a comprehensive tribute website.</div><!----></thought-item></div><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><img _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" alt="" class="google-icon ng-tns-c2729692570-33" src="https://www.gstatic.com/lamda/images/immersives/google_logo_icon_2380fba942c84387f09cf.svg"></div><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line is-first ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><browse-chip-list _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c1707181277=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-container ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-header gds-body-m"> Researching websites </div><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-chip-container"><browse-web-chip _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" _nghost-ng-c3225172412="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" matripple="" class="mat-ripple browse-chip"><img _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" alt="Icon of the website" data-test-id="favicon" class="icon" src="https://t0.gstatic.com/faviconV2?url=https://apnews.com/&amp;client=BARD&amp;type=FAVICON&amp;size=256&amp;fallback_opts=TYPE,SIZE,URL"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="domain-name" class="display-name gds-label-m">apnews.com</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="title" class="sub-title gds-label-m">Robert Prevost, first pope from US in history of the Catholic Church, takes the name Leo XIV - | Vatican, May 8th, 2025 - YouTube</div></div></browse-web-chip><!----><!----><!----></div></div><!----></browse-chip-list></div><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted"><mat-icon _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="img" fonticon="spark" class="mat-icon notranslate ng-tns-c2729692570-33 google-symbols mat-ligature-font mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font" data-mat-icon-name="spark"></mat-icon></div><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 is-first mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Confirmation and Initial Details</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I've successfully confirmed through multiple news outlets that Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost was indeed announced as Pope Leo XIV on May 8th, 2025. He is noted as the first Pope from the United States, a significant historical point. His background includes being a missionary in Peru and holding a key Vatican role overseeing bishop nominations.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Next Steps in Research</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">Now that I've confirmed the announcement, I'll delve deeper into various aspects of Pope Leo XIV's life and career. This includes gathering detailed biographical information, understanding his previous roles within the Church, and identifying any notable writings or public statements he has made.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Exploring His Impact</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I also intend to research significant events or achievements in his career, identify key themes or areas of focus in his work, and explore the historical context of the name 'Leo' within the papacy. This comprehensive approach will allow me to gather the necessary information for building a meaningful tribute website.</div><!----></thought-item></div><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><div _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Expanding Biographical Details</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I've found more information about Pope Leo XIV's background. He was born in Chicago, holds both U.S. and Peruvian citizenship, and has a long history of missionary work in Peru. Before becoming Pope, he served as the Prefect of the Dicastery for Bishops, a significant role in the Vatican.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Understanding Previous Roles</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">My research indicates that Pope Leo XIV was appointed to a key Vatican position by Pope Francis in 2023, specifically to oversee the selection of new bishops worldwide. This suggests a level of trust and alignment with the previous Pope's vision for the Church. He also served as bishop in Peru for several years.</div><!----></thought-item></div><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 Here's why pontiffs change their names and what they mean. - CBS News</div></div></browse-web-chip><!----><!----><!----></div></div><!----></browse-chip-list></div><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted"><mat-icon _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="img" fonticon="spark" class="mat-icon notranslate ng-tns-c2729692570-33 google-symbols mat-ligature-font mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font" data-mat-icon-name="spark"></mat-icon></div><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 is-first mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Key Insights Gained</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I've learned that Pope Leo XIV, formerly Robert Francis Prevost, is the first American Pope and also holds Peruvian citizenship due to his extensive missionary work in Peru. His appointment as Prefect of the Dicastery for Bishops by Pope Francis in 2023 highlights his importance within the Church hierarchy prior to his election. His initial message emphasized peace, dialogue, and missionary work, echoing themes from Pope Francis's leadership.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Areas for Further Exploration</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">While I have a good overview of his background and initial statements, I still need to delve deeper into Pope Leo XIV's specific views on various social and doctrinal issues. I also want to understand the historical significance of choosing the name 'Leo' and research any notable events or controversies during his career, such as the reported allegations regarding his handling of abuse cases.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Next Research Focus</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">To gain a more complete understanding, I will now focus on finding more detailed information about Pope Leo XIV's past statements and actions, particularly during his time as Bishop of Chiclayo and in his Vatican role. I will also investigate the history of Popes named Leo to see if there are any patterns or connections that might shed light on his chosen name and potential direction for the papacy.</div><!----></thought-item></div><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><img _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" alt="" class="google-icon ng-tns-c2729692570-33" src="https://www.gstatic.com/lamda/images/immersives/google_logo_icon_2380fba942c84387f09cf.svg"></div><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line is-first ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><browse-chip-list _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c1707181277=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-container ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-header gds-body-m"> Researching websites </div><div _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" class="browse-chip-container"><browse-web-chip _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" _nghost-ng-c3225172412="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" matripple="" class="mat-ripple browse-chip"><img _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" alt="Icon of the website" data-test-id="favicon" class="icon" src="https://t0.gstatic.com/faviconV2?url=https://apnews.com/&amp;client=BARD&amp;type=FAVICON&amp;size=256&amp;fallback_opts=TYPE,SIZE,URL"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="domain-name" class="display-name gds-label-m">apnews.com</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="title" class="sub-title gds-label-m">Prevost, now Pope Leo XIV, overcame a taboo against a US pontiff - U.S. Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost is new pontiff, Pope Leo XIV!</div></div></browse-web-chip><!----><!----><browse-web-chip _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" _nghost-ng-c3225172412="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" matripple="" class="mat-ripple browse-chip"><img _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" alt="Icon of the website" data-test-id="favicon" class="icon" src="https://t0.gstatic.com/faviconV2?url=https://www.youtube.com/&amp;client=BARD&amp;type=FAVICON&amp;size=256&amp;fallback_opts=TYPE,SIZE,URL"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="domain-name" class="display-name gds-label-m">youtube.com</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="title" class="sub-title gds-label-m">FULL: Pope Leo XIV's first words to crowd in Vatican City - YouTube</div></div></browse-web-chip><!----><!----><browse-web-chip _ngcontent-ng-c1707181277="" _nghost-ng-c3225172412="" class="ng-star-inserted"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" matripple="" class="mat-ripple browse-chip"><img _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" alt="Icon of the website" data-test-id="favicon" class="icon" src="https://t1.gstatic.com/faviconV2?url=https://catholicreview.org/&amp;client=BARD&amp;type=FAVICON&amp;size=256&amp;fallback_opts=TYPE,SIZE,URL"><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="domain-name" class="display-name gds-label-m">catholicreview.org</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c3225172412="" data-test-id="title" class="sub-title gds-label-m">Archbishop Prevost talks about choosing bishops for the church - Catholic Review</div></div></browse-web-chip><!----><!----><!----></div></div><!----></browse-chip-list></div><!----><!----><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="icon-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted"><mat-icon _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="img" fonticon="spark" class="mat-icon notranslate ng-tns-c2729692570-33 google-symbols mat-ligature-font mat-icon-no-color" aria-hidden="true" data-mat-icon-type="font" data-mat-icon-name="spark"></mat-icon></div><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 is-first mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Deeper Understanding of His Views</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I've gained new insights into Pope Leo XIV's perspectives. While he seems to align with Pope Francis on outreach to the poor and migrants, some past statements suggest a more conservative stance on LGBTQ+ issues and gender ideology. This indicates a nuanced approach to different social matters.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Significance of Papal Name</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">Thinking about his choice of 'Leo XIV', I've researched previous Popes with this name. Pope Leo I is known for his strong defense of Church doctrine, and Pope Leo XIII for his engagement with modern social issues. This suggests that Pope Leo XIV's papacy might focus on a combination of upholding traditional teachings and addressing contemporary challenges.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Addressing Past Allegations</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">I've also found information regarding allegations about Pope Leo XIV's handling of abuse cases in the past, both in Chicago and Peru. It's important to acknowledge these concerns on the website while also including any available responses or clarifications from the Church or his supporters to provide a balanced view.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Key Themes for the Website</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">Considering all the information gathered, I believe the tribute website should highlight his unique position as the first American Pope with strong ties to Peru, his extensive missionary and administrative experience, his emphasis on unity and dialogue, his alignment with some of Pope Francis's priorities, his potentially more conservative views on certain topics, the significance of his chosen name, and the controversies surrounding past allegations.</div><!----></thought-item></div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-container ng-tns-c2729692570-33 ng-star-inserted" style=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="item-side ng-tns-c2729692570-33"><!----><mat-divider _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" role="separator" class="mat-divider item-side-line ng-tns-c2729692570-33 mat-divider-vertical" aria-orientation="vertical"></mat-divider></div><thought-item _ngcontent-ng-c2729692570="" class="ng-tns-c2729692570-33" _nghost-ng-c2256467784=""><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-header gds-body-m">Finalizing Research</div><div _ngcontent-ng-c2256467784="" class="thought-body gds-body-m">Having explored these key areas in detail and reviewed information from multiple sources, I feel I have a comprehensive understanding of Pope Leo XIV. I will now move on to synthesizing this information into a detailed report that can be used to build the tribute website.</div><!----></thought-item></div><!----><!----><!----><!----><!----></div><div File: ai_contexts/openai.html

class="hover:bg-token-main-surface-secondary cursor-pointer rounded-md p-2"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-md-heavy text-token-text-tertiary"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M11.2929 3.29289C11.6834 2.90237 12.3166 2.90237 12.7071 3.29289L16.7071 7.29289C17.0976 7.68342 17.0976 8.31658 16.7071 8.70711C16.3166 9.09763 15.6834 9.09763 15.2929 8.70711L13 6.41421V15C13 15.5523 12.5523 16 12 16C11.4477 16 11 15.5523 11 15V6.41421L8.70711 8.70711C8.31658 9.09763 7.68342 9.09763 7.29289 8.70711C6.90237 8.31658 6.90237 7.68342 7.29289 7.29289L11.2929 3.29289ZM4 14C4.55228 14 5 14.4477 5 15V18C5 18.5523 5.44772 19 6 19H18C18.5523 19 19 18.5523 19 18V15C19 14.4477 19.4477 14 20 14C20.5523 14 21 14.4477 21 15V18C21 19.6569 19.6569 21 18 21H6C4.34315 21 3 19.6569 3 18V15C3 14.4477 3.44772 14 4 14Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg></div></div><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="4ec74a2d-804f-4bb1-a2af-e6a050ff2f2c" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark deep-research-result"><h1 data-start="0" data-end="70" class="">Pope Leo XIV (Robert Francis Prevost) – Timeline &amp; Legendary Profile</h1>
<p data-start="72" data-end="949" class=""><strong data-start="72" data-end="88">Pope Leo XIV</strong> (born Robert Francis Prevost) was elected on May 8, 2025 as the 267th pope of the Catholic Church<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=On%208%C2%A0May%202025%2C%20the%20second,33" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. A Chicago-born American with deep roots in Peru, he made history as the first North American (and naturalized Peruvian) pontiff<span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/prevost-first-us-pope-supported-francis-shunned-spotlight-2025-05-08/#:~:text=VATICAN%20CITY%2C%20May%208%20,unknown%20on%20the%20global%20stage" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">reuters.com</span></span></span></a></span></span><span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/prevost-first-us-pope-supported-francis-shunned-spotlight-2025-05-08/#:~:text=said%20Francis%2C%20who%20leads%20the,of%20the%20Viatorian%20religious%20order" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">reuters.com</span></span></span></a></span></span>. A member of the Augustinian Order, he is also the seventh Augustinian friar to become pope – the first since Pope Eugene IV in the 15th century<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Pope%20Leo%C2%A0XIV,to%20lead%20the%20Catholic%20Church" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. Leo&nbsp;XIV’s life story reads like a legend: a mathematician-turned-missionary, a humble friar who rose to lead a global Church, and a pastor-scholar with a heart for the poor and a mind for canon law. Below is a detailed timeline of his journey, followed by an engaging character-style profile highlighting his titles, traits, and teachings.</p>
<h2 data-start="951" data-end="1003" class="">Timeline of Key Milestones in the Life of Leo XIV</h2>
<ul data-start="1005" data-end="9536">
<li data-start="1005" data-end="1440" class="">
<p data-start="1007" data-end="1440" class=""><strong data-start="1007" data-end="1017">1955 –</strong> <strong data-start="1018" data-end="1043">Birth and Early Life:</strong> Born on September 14, 1955, in Chicago, Illinois, to a devout Catholic family<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Robert%20Francis%20Prevost%20was%20born,mathematics%20at%20Villanova%20University%20in" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. Raised in a bilingual household (with French-Italian and Spanish heritage), he served as an altar boy and attended an Augustinian minor seminary in his youth<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Robert%20Francis%20Prevost%20was%20born,mathematics%20at%20Villanova%20University%20in" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. This early exposure to faith and clergy planted the seeds of his religious vocation.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1442" data-end="2018" class="">
<p data-start="1444" data-end="2018" class=""><strong data-start="1444" data-end="1454">1977 –</strong> <strong data-start="1455" data-end="1476">Augustinian Vows:</strong> After earning a Bachelor’s degree in mathematics from Villanova University in 1977, he decided to pursue the priesthood<span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=child%2C%20Prevost%20served%20as%20an,8" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span></span><span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://abc7chicago.com/post/2025-is-new-pope-cardinal-robert-francis-prevost-1st-american-chicago-elected-catholic-church-leader/16358670/#:~:text=Prevost%20earned%20his%20bachelor%27s%20in,Catholic%20Theological%20Union%20of%20Chicago" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">abc7chicago.com</span></span></span></a></span></span>. He joined the <strong data-start="1686" data-end="1712">Order of St. Augustine</strong> in 1977, attracted by its ideals of unity and community life<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://www.pillarcatholic.com/p/meet-the-conclave-cardinal-robert#:~:text=Once%20he%20was%20convinced%20of,Augustine%20of%20Hippo" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">pillarcatholic.com</span></span></span></a></span>. He professed first vows in 1978 and solemn (permanent) vows by 1981<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Augustinian%20" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>, embracing the Augustinians’ spiritual emphasis on communal faith and the teachings of St. Augustine.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2020" data-end="2562" class="">
<p data-start="2022" data-end="2562" class=""><strong data-start="2022" data-end="2032">1982 –</strong> <strong data-start="2033" data-end="2057">Priestly Ordination:</strong> Prevost was ordained as a Catholic priest in Rome on June 19, 1982<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Prevost%20was%20ordained%20a%20priest,11" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. He completed a Master of Divinity at Catholic Theological Union (Chicago) and was sent to Rome for advanced studies<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Deciding%20to%20become%20a%20priest%2C,time.%5B%207" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. Fluent in several languages even then, he would later speak English, Spanish, Italian, French, and Portuguese, with reading knowledge of Latin and German<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=child%2C%20Prevost%20served%20as%20an,8" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span> – a polyglot priest prepared for global service.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2564" data-end="2940" class="">
<p data-start="2566" data-end="2940" class=""><strong data-start="2566" data-end="2576">1987 –</strong> <strong data-start="2577" data-end="2601">Doctor of Canon Law:</strong> Continuing his education, Fr. Prevost earned a Licentiate (1984) and then a Doctorate in Canon Law in 1987 from the <strong data-start="2718" data-end="2774">Pontifical College of St. Thomas Aquinas (Angelicum)</strong> in Rome<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Prevost%20was%20ordained%20a%20priest,11" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. This solid scholarly foundation in Church law and theology would inform his later work in guiding Church leadership.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2942" data-end="3828" class="">
<p data-start="2944" data-end="3828" class=""><strong data-start="2944" data-end="2959">1985–1998 –</strong> <strong data-start="2960" data-end="2983">Missionary in Peru:</strong> Demonstrating a <strong data-start="3000" data-end="3019">missionary zeal</strong>, he served in Peru for over a decade. In 1985, he joined an Augustinian mission in the rural <strong data-start="3113" data-end="3152">Territorial Prelature of Chulucanas</strong>, where he acted as chancellor of the local Church jurisdiction<span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Prevost#:~:text=Prevost%20joined%20the%20Augustinian%20mission,13" target="_blank" rel="noopener" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[0.5625em] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between overflow-hidden" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">en.wikipedia.org</span></span></span></a></span>. After a brief return to Rome to finish his doctorate, he went back to Peru in 1988, spending the next ten years in <strong data-start="3371" data-end="3383">Trujillo</strong>.
